revision.comment:
Changed: ..."Puppy Dog Pals, and the ABC sitcom as a jerk The Middle."
To: ... "Puppy Dog Pals, and the ABC sitcom The Middle."
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Jack McBrayer | image = Jackmcbrayer.jpg | imagesize = 160px | alt = | caption = McBrayer in [[New York City]] in March 2007 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|5|27}} | birth_place = [[Macon, Georgia]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, comedian | yearsactive = 1999–present | alma_mater = [[University of Evansville]] }} '''Jack McBrayer''' ({{IPAc-en|m|ə|k|ˈ|b|r|ɛər}}; born May 27, 1973) is an American actor and comedian, who gained national exposure for his portrayal of characters on ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'' and as [[Kenneth Parcell]] in ''[[30 Rock]]'', for which he was nominated for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series]] at the [[61st Primetime Emmy Awards]].{{cite press release |title=Academy of Television Arts and Sciences 61st Primetime Emmy Awards |url=http://www.emmys.tv/sites/emmys.tv/files/61stemmys_noms_1.pdf |publisher=[[Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]]. |date=2009-07-16 |format=PDF |accessdate=2010-11-13}} During his time at [[The Walt Disney Company]], he has voiced a major character in the 2012 film ''[[Wreck-it Ralph]]'' and later its [[Ralph Breaks the Internet: Wreck-It Ralph 2|2018 sequel]], as well as recurring characters in ''[[Wander Over Yonder]]'', ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'', ''[[Puppy Dog Pals]]'', and the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] sitcom ''[[The Middle (TV series)|The Middle]]''. ==Personal life== McBrayer was born in [[Macon, Georgia]], and moved to [[Conyers, Georgia]] when he was 15. He studied theater administration at the [[University of Evansville]], Indiana.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/04/06/arts/television/06itzk.html|title=Not-So-Alter Ego of Kenneth the Page, Still Soaking It In |author=Itzkoff, Dave|date=2008-04-06|work= [[The New York Times]] |accessdate=2010-11-13}} From 1995 to 2002 he worked at [[The Second City]] and [[IO Theater]] in Chicago, an experience that introduced him to ''30 Rock'' creator [[Tina Fey]] and prepared him for his role on her show.{{cite web| url= http://www.chicagonow.com/blogs/show-patrol/2009/10/jack-mcbrayer-kenny-the-page-30-rock.html | title= Jack McBrayer or Kenny the Page? 'Same thing,' says '30 Rock' star | date= October 9, 2009 | publisher= [[ChicagoNow]] | work= Show Patrol (blog) | accessdate=2010-07-20}} ==Career== McBrayer appeared in over 80 sketches on ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'' (2002–04), often lampooning his own [[Southern United States|Southern]] upbringing by playing stereotypical [[hillbilly]] characters. On August 10, 2007 and September 20, 2008 he made cameo appearances on ''Late Night'' playing [[Kenneth Parcell]] from ''30 Rock''. During the first appearance, O'Brien remarked to him, "I thought you were above this now." McBrayer later reprised his role as Kenneth twice (November 24, 2009 and January 13, 2010) after O'Brien's switch to ''[[The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien|The Tonight Show]]'', and appeared on O'Brien's [[The Legally Prohibited from Being Funny on Television Tour|Legally Prohibited From Being Funny on Television Tour]] at stops in [[Eugene, Oregon]], [[Universal City, California]] (on the [[Universal Studios]] lot where O'Brien taped ''Tonight''), and the final tour stop in [[Atlanta]], in his home state of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/daily/entertainment/2010/04/conans_first_tour_stop_self-pl.html|title=Conan’s First Tour Stop: Triumph, Self-Pleasuring Pandas, and Spoon|date=2010-04-13|work= [[New York (magazine)|New York]] |accessdate=2010-11-13}}{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/04/coanan-back-at-nbc-universal-for-two-nights-bad-ideas-are-being-greenlit-here/|title=Conan Back at NBC Universal (For Two Nights): "Bad Ideas Are Being Greenlit" Here|author=Andreeva, Nellie|date=2010-04-25|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=2010-11-13}} In 2008, he was featured throughout the video for "[[Touch My Body (Mariah Carey song)|Touch My Body]]" by [[Mariah Carey]]. McBrayer said he accidentally hit Carey in the face with a [[Frisbee]] during the shooting for the video. McBrayer also appears in the first episode in the fifth season of ''[[Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'' as a spokesman in a spoof advertisement for the fictional "Diarrhea-phragm."{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/tim-eric-awesome-show-great-job-season-5-premiere,38658/|title=Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job! - Season 5 premiere|author=Heisler, Steve|date=2010-03-01|work= [[The A.V. Club]]|accessdate=2010-11-13}} He worked as a voice actor in the American animated series ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/37205/ugly-americans-season-finale-kong-queens|title=Ugly Americans Season Finale: Kong of Queens|author=Moore, Debi|date=2010-04-27|work= Dread Centralteacher|accessdate=2010-11-13}} and in a recurring role on the second season of ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'', playing the part of [[List of Phineas and Ferb characters#Irving|Irving]], a fan of Phineas and Ferb. In 2010, he played a role in ''[[Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore]].'' He regularly appears in the skit "Knock Knock Joke of the Day" on the hit children's television show, ''[[Yo Gabba Gabba!]]'' since season 2{{cite web|url=http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1464960.php/Jack_Black_to_guest_star_on_Yo_Gabba_Gabba|title=Jack Black to guest star on Yo Gabba Gabba|author=MacIntyre, April|date=2009-03-16|work=[[Monsters and Critics]]|accessdate=2010-11-13|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100811231821/http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1464960.php/Jack_Black_to_guest_star_on_Yo_Gabba_Gabba|archivedate=2010-08-11|df=}} and stars in [[Craig McCracken]]'s new TV show ''[[Wander Over Yonder]]'' on the Disney Channel. In the fall of 2012, Jack lent his voice to the Disney animated film ''[[Wreck-It Ralph]]'', playing the title character's close friend and video game opponent Fix-It Felix, Jr. More recently, he has starred alongside [[Los Angeles Clippers]] player [[Blake Griffin]] in [[Kia Motors|Kia]] commercials, and in 2013 appeared in a commercial for [[Barnes & Noble]].{{citation needed|date=December 2014}} McBrayer's [[Adult Swim]] series ''[[The Jack and Triumph Show]]'' premiered in February 2015. In September 2016, on the season 10 premiere episode of ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]'', McBrayer played Penny's older brother Randall. In 2018, McBrayer was one of the actors who voiced the audiobook ''[[A Day in the Life of Marlon Bundo]]''.{{cite news |last=Perkins |first=Dennis |date=March 19, 2018 |title=John Oliver hijacks homophobe Mike Pence's bunny book with a better one in A Day In The Life Of Marlon Bundo |url=https://www.avclub.com/john-oliver-hijacks-homophobe-mike-pences-bunny-book-wi-1823879129 |work=AV Club |location= |access-date=March 19, 2018 }} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
